Oren  Gil from SOD did a complete remodel of our kitchen We purchased appliances but they did everything else gutted the existing kitchen and floor installed brand new electrical plumbing floor walls and even removed a loadbearing wall to open up the kitchen to the den They took care of all of the permits inspections  fees Member Comments We interviewed 7 contractors four from word of mouth and  three through Angies list One by one they came through and spoke with us about cost design how they operated and timelines Each one either had their own idea of how they would do it or was way to high in price or just indifferent but when SOD Builders Ore  Gil stopped by they made us feel very comfortable they helped us see our vision They started right away with demo and worked quickly they seem to be very well organized and since they have their own electricians carpenters and plumbers on staff there was no waiting for the subcontractor to stop by

Kraftmaster crated a beautiful bathroom for us from a connected room to our master bedroom The room and the side of the house it was on had no plumbing but the Moon Danny and Mike did a great job analyzing how to best get pipes to the room Krftmaster provides a full service construction service and it starts with interviews and then design Carly listed to what we wanted out of the renovation and then provided us with 3 different designs with different budgets to choose from We then went shopping together to work together to pick out the tiles counter materials sinks toilets fixtures etc They have lots of knowledge around these things and can answer any question

The carpenters and electricians did great work Chris Nick and Renan are precise electricians  every screw on the switch plates is aligned upanddown which just shows you their attention to detail and the tile work was amazing Bogdan is an incredibly skilled and throughout tileperson and spent considerable time on the mud job and tile work Super precise

What was great was that near the end of the job we werent 100 happy with the alignment of a towlrack we made some changes to plans during construction and the carpenter who installed it didnt see the update it happens and I pointed it out to Chris who agreed it should be fixed It wasnt an easy fix as the tiles had to be broken off and replaced the the bar realigned but they did it and it promptly

Our family is thrilled with our recent kitchen remodel from KraftMaster Renovations  Bob and his team transformed our kitchen from closedoff and dated to the open modern center of our home  It has transformed the feel of the entire house  It is something our family will enjoy and can be very proud of

Bob and Team are great  I used KraftMaster for my large kitchen remodel project in Summer 2018  The project took 25 months  While this company is not the cheapest quote they really do keep to their timeline and professionalism  Many times contractors will lose interest or start another job and never finish  Not KraftMaster and even towards the end of the project i never felt like i was a secondary thought to them  They remained on schedule and finished on time  They maintained good contact and updates throughout the project  The main project managers Peter and Walter were so courteous and professional  Would definitely recommend this firm to anyone in the area looking to do a large or small remodel

The 2 things that come to mind working with Kraftmaster are craftsmanship and professionalism In the past Ive worked with contractors that were really good in one of those areas but lacked in the other 

The team was excellent to work with Maureen is a true design talent She took the time to get to know my wife and I to get a better understanding of the aesthetic we were looking for She guided us through the big picture design comp process down to the little fixture details There were a couple of instances where it took some extra prodding on her part to get us to purchase detail that was out of our original scope and budget but she has a way of explaining how the extra investment would enhance the overall look Glad we took her advice

Chris and the electrical team were great Very responsive to some adjustments that needed to be made along the process 

As the company owner I was pleasantly surprised how involved Bob was throughout He didnt sell the project and then disappear He was communicative during the entire process When we hit a roadblock on the project Bob worked with me to find a solution 

Overall a great time I recommended them to some good friends who have also started a major remodel project with Kraftmaster

Bob and team were excellent from Day 1  We decided to go with Bobs team because of his patience and his one stop shop team  A large reno like ours can be very intimidating  We also live in an HOA community so there are additional rules and guidelines that Bob and team had to become familiar with  The team had all sorts of excellent design ideas and helped us narrow things down when we got overwhelmed with choices  The designer  construction crew electrician and everyone else involved were personable professional and trustworthy  We love our new kitchen

Bob and the KraftMaster team turned our house built in 1903 into the home we always knew it could be  The team really helps you through the project from beginning to end  The design process went smoothly and logistical coordination was quite impressive  Everything was always there on time and highly organized  For our primary points of contact Id like to specifically say a few words about

Kim was a huge help as the designer for our project  She took the rough ideas for our layout and flushed them out with better ideas and a smarter use of space  Especially for our master bath and walkin closet which had an odd shaped room due to the dormer  It was definitely the smartest way to layout the bathroom and optimized my wifes walk in closet  

When it came to picking out countertops tile and fixtures thank God we had Kim  It would have taken us a dozen trips and several fights to get to the decisions we made in two  Kim had great ideas but also gave us the space we needed to make our own decisions  It was a good balance  

Kim was also very responsive to our daily communications and what seemed like a thousand Change Orders  She was great at answering questions and allaying any concerns that we had  Overall Kim was a huge reason our project turned out so great  

Nick is an amazing craftsman  He is super knowledgeable with incredible attention to detail  I really appreciated this  Our house was built in 1903 and we wanted to match the detailed molding throughout the rest of the house  I can only image the pain that was  He was also great at dealing with and suggesting solutions to the charm aka problems that these old houses present  I really couldnt imagine the house turning out better  It is a work of art  

Did we hit small bumps in the road  Sure but every project does and those bumps were taken care of quickly  We are very happy with the project and look forward to spending many years in our home with our family creating memories

When we purchased our home we knew that we wanted to renovate the kitchen and family room space to open it up and give it a better flow We researched several local companies and settled on KraftMaster Renovations We had an idea of what we were looking to do but with the help of Bob Kim and their team we were able to realize the dream of our perfect kitchen space From start to finish we were kept in the loop about timeline changes new ideas and everyone was responsive to our questions and changes We are so happy with our new kitchen and highly recommend KraftMaster Renovations to anyone we know looking to renovate

We have worked with Bob and his team on multiple projects  The first project was a transformative kitchen remodel where not only did the team reimagine the space in ways we would never have thought possible the ideas they had for finishes and the final design exceeded all of our expectations  Our latest project was a technical siding replacement of tongue and groove cedar in a 1978 architect designed home and the results again exceeded our expectations  Bobs onsite crews are skilled and always professional  Bob himself is incredibly experienced very open to new ideas with amazing contacts and resources for the most unusual materials Case in point the glass backsplash behind the stove  An original photo taken by my husband transformed   If you can imagine it he can bring it to life  He also has great rapport with local inspectors and townships which enables the smooth execution of  projects

When my wife and I decided to renovate our kitchen bathroom and other parts of our house we set out to find someone who could capture our style which is a bit unorthodox provide high quality craftsmanship and do so within our budget expectations   KraftMaster Renovations absolutely delivered  

As my wife and I started the process we were fortunate that we share a common design aestheticsort of a fusion of MidCentury Modern and European Modern  We however were also aware that this style is not that common in Northern New Jersey  As we met with other design and build companies many struggled to grasp the design elements that we sought and often redirected us to more traditional lines cabinetry fixtures and colors  However after meeting Bob and seeing his portfolio of work we thought that KraftMaster Renovations would be able to capture the look we wanted

Our confidence was absolutely rewarded  Maureen our designer at KraftMaster did a perfect job fusing our ideas together into a cohesive design that not only is beautiful but also practical in its layout and space optimization  Maureen also displayed incredible patience with us or with me to be more precise as we modified some of the original design work after demolition revealed some issues with the house  

As our project moved into the construction phase we were exceptionally impressed by the craftsmanship and attention to detail of all the tradesmen  Nick Carlos and Camilo the primary carpenters are perfectionists  This is evident in their own work as well as their expectations of products purchased for the projectrejecting cabinets tiles hardware that were not perfect  Danny the primary plumber and Chris the primary electrician provided excellent work that was obviously done with care and pride  

Throughout the entire process Bob was always involved and always responsive  Early in the project he proposed alternatives that could save us some money or told us that certain items were unnecessary expenses  As the project advanced he helped provide some creative solutions to structural issues that surfaced during demolition  As the project was winding down Bob made sure that we were pleased with everything and made sure that any final adjustments were done to our satisfaction  

Based on our experience we highly recommend KraftMaster Renovations due to its quality of work and level of service  And if your design preferences are more modern than traditional you should absolutely meet with KraftMaster Renovations before starting your renovation or remodeling project

Bob Gockeler Maureen Madigan and the entire KraftMaster Renovations Team is setting the standard that all contractors and home remodel companies should strive for  ACCOUNTABILITYPROFESSIONALISMDOING THE RIGHT THINGEXTRAORDINARY SERVICEEXPERTISE  A COMMITMENT TO STICKING TO WHAT WAS AGREED UPON are some of the A qualities we received in working with the KraftMaster Team  Not only are we in love with our full bathroom remodel but we know with complete certainty knowing that the work was completed correctly  The design concept for the small space was something we could not have envisioned and the end result was even more gorgeous that what we anticipated One of things that impressed us most is that the team stayed on schedule  When I share that fact with friends and family they are blown away Day 1 of the project they arrived when expected and left as agreed upon through the end of the project  This is how they were able to standby the time frame we had originally discussed  We really enjoyed working with the team and look forward to working with them again

I  highly recommend KraftMaster Renovations  The toughest part of my kitchen renovation MayJune 2016 was packing up 60 years of my moms grandmothers and my appliances and dishes to make way for the KraftMaster guys to get to work I moved back into my childhood home after my mom passed away a few years prior to the renovation and was happy I chose Bob Maureen and their team to turn my moms kitchen into my own  In keeping with the style of the midcentury Cape we expanded the kitchens storage capacity and enhanced its cottage ambiance with Shakerstyle cabinetry finished in Marshmallow Cream Subtle wood grain porcelain plank floor tiles a beautiful Cambria Quartz countertop highlighted by a Pumice subway tile backsplash carried my 1941 Cape into the 21st century without sacrificing its midcentury modern footprint and charm  Everyone whos seen it cant believe the transformation From day one the guys showed up every day to gut install tile drywall and plaster The exceptionally skilled tilers often stayed late to finish a job  It was such a pleasure working with designer Maureen Bob son Robbie and their team that I am planning to continue working with them on upcoming jobs as well

I recently had my kitchen and bathroom renovated by KraftMaster  Im thrilled with the redo  Working the Kim the designer and Bob was exactly what I was looking for  guidance on various ideas with best practices incorporated  The work crew obviously care about their work as everything was done with top notch quality  They were flexible by working around some unique challenges  Everything was planned well and the work went along smoothly  KraftMaster was exactly the type of contractor that I was looking for  Thank you to the entire team  I love my new spaces

Having never undergone a major renovation we were very apprehensive about the entire kitchen renovation process  However we cant say enough about Bob Gockeler and his entire team  Bob and Kim were extremely involved responsive and helpful in every aspect of the project from the design stage to picking out fixtures to the final small details that we would never have even thought of They were beyond patient with all of our questions and went above and beyond to ensure that we were happy and confident in the choices that  were made  The Crew that worked on the kitchen were professionals in every sense of the word  Their work was top quality they were friendly left the work area clean and were very easy to have around  The final result was beyond what we had hoped for  Our kitchen is beautiful  We would highly recommend working with Kraftmaster Renovations

Last Fall my wife and I met with Bob and Kim a few times and our experience was so poor that I want to come back to this because the overwhelmingly positive reviews on Houzz simply do not capture the complete picture on their business  Rather than go through a detailed blow by blow of our experience I think its more valuable to Houzz users that I just get to the bottom line  In our view Bob is a charming guy who markets a designbuild offering in which customers end up over paying for the product they end up getting  An argument could be made that youre paying to have one stop shop and your hand held  Having said that the proposal we got from Bob was so generalized in terms of the design detail that it was just not useful if you want a high end product when it comes to cabinetry and carpentry it is ALL about the details  So we decided to go shop  Immediately two things became clear  One most kitchen design specialists understand that you have to get very detailed in the design unless you want a fairly pedestrian product  Two we would be able to get a much better quality cabinetfinishoverall productproject for roughly speaking 20 percent less than what was quoted by Bob  Now that our project is 97 done I can tell you by experience that this is exactly what we achievedwe got a vastly better overall end product for substantially less money

Bob you may not realize this about me but I am a perfectionistinterior design junkie  Having been called on one or two occasions by people close to me that I am a control freak which I do take as a compliment  Details details details its my mantra  focusing on how I can manage the what ifs in any situation  It gives me great comfort knowing my actions can affect the outcomes to situations I have control for  So you can only imagine the amount of TRUST and CONFIDENCE I placed in you and your team  After doing my due diligence research to assure I was going to get exactly what I had hoped and dreamed for which happened to be 10 years in the making  I was placing  No pressure on you  right  Well I can wholeheartedly state  You completely exceeded my expectations I feel like I am in a design magazine every time I enter my kitchen  It is truly breathtaking and extremely functional
Communication  it is a valuable cornerstone of your performance  You kept us abreast of every situation  and they are bound to occur in a house that is over 50 years old   Your suggestions for solutions gave us options which appealed to my sensibilities 
Your team of professionals were remarkable and it is our privilege to acknowledge them
Kims design ideas along with her education on products and materials gave us the intelligence to make important decisions  She is so sweet a pleasure to work with  I miss coming to the showroom to go over the plan with her
Andrews work ethic is one for the record books  His boundless energy and determination to get my kitchen done was his ultimate priority  We felt so lucky to be in his infallible hands  A true craftsman
Maynar and his cousin are flooring geniuses  Their talent of feathering in the new kitchen hardwood to the dining room is unbelievable  The stain color is so rich and the steps are gorgeous  
Robbie your son is a wonderful Project Manager  His attention to detail is phenomenal his diligence to protect our floors when the appliances arrived surely saved us from catastrophe  He is a personable young man with great communication skills apple didnt fall far from the tree  
Integrity Quality Experience Reliable Talented   these are some of the words that we associate with KraftMaster Renovations   To those who are embarking on this journey of home renovation you couldnt be in more capable hands  I know you will be truly astonished with their capabilities  we are

After Bob Gockeler and his incredible KraftMaster crew finished work on our Kitchen see review from October 2015 it was only natural to move on to the living room Weve been busy relaxing in our new space so it has taken a while to write this review

Once again everyone at KraftMaster exceeded expectations while keeping the project within budget  From Maureen and Kims design suggestions and drawings to Robbie Gockelers Bobs son project setup and support to the fine craftsmanship and attention to detail by Bobs subcontractorsnot to mention our additions to the projectwe were totally satisfied  Cant wait to start work on the upstairs

Review of Master Bath Renovation by Kraftmasters

Summary
Very pleased with both the design and construction of the new master bath
Kraftmasters was the most creative contractor we spoke with when trying to come up with a design to fit in our fairly difficult space constraints
The work crew was attentive to our home and made every effort to minimize the disruption
The workmanship was top notch
The end result was just what we had hoped for

Discussion

We spoke with several contractors about renovating our master bath  The problem was we had a dressing area with a sink and a closet and a separate bath with another sink a toilet and a bath tub with shower  We wanted a separate walk in shower but the configuration of the rooms made it a real challenge to design a renovation without making undesirable concessions  Bob and Kim were the only contractordesigners who said they could up with a plan to meet our needs and they did  We brainstormed with Bob and Kim and together we came up with a creative design that had a walkin shower and separate room for the toilet a tub and a reoriented closet with an entrance from the master bedroom rather than the bath

Kim not only came up with the initial overall design she provided very helpful input to assist us in making all the detailed design decisions  Kim went shopping with us at vendors recommended by Bob for granite counter tops floor tile and bathroom fixtures  We were able to select our cabinets right in Bobs showroom in Chatham and the cabinets are very attractive and well made

The job was started promptly  Bob arranged for the construction permit and scheduled the needed inspections  The first step in the project was to put down protective material in the garage where the construction material was stored on the stairs and in the master bedroom to minimize the impact of the construction on the areas near the construction  It is construction so there is still going to be a considerable amount of dust and dirt it is unavoidable

Bobs work crew were all friendly and knew what they were doing  Tony the foreman did most of the plumbing and the layout of the framing  He was very attentive to detail and consulted with us when he thought there was a decision to be made  Yuri did a number of jobs and did them well but he really showed his talent as the tile installer  He did a super job installing the tile in the shower the tile around the tub and the river pebble floor in the shower

Towards the end the job took a bit longer than anticipated as Bob had a number of jobs going at the same time and so the crew was not as available to us as they had been when the project was started  Bob gave us a quote at the start of the project and the quote was only changed for areas that we agreed to  The total cost of the project was somewhat over our initial budget but we felt that it was worth the extra cost to get all of what we wanted

Upon completion we could not have been more pleased  The workmanship was top notch the design works as planned and is very pleasing to us and all the detailed design decisions came together to create a Master Bath that we thoroughly enjoy
KraftMaster Renovations is an amazing company and we always enjoy working with them They are extremely efficient passionate and they truly go above and beyond

Bob Gockeler and his team at KraftMaster Renovations are magicians  After living in our 30 year old home for 12 years we decided to undertake a massive master bathcloset renovation This soon expanded to a new foyer staircase and hardwood floor refinishing A three month project  From the very first meeting with Bobs crack design team of Kim and Maureen we were hooked  Kim and Maureen were able to translate our conflicting jumbled list of ideas into a workable plan suggesting viable alternatives to our non workable ideas and giving rise to new thoughts through their design expertise Once construction started Andrew and Igor  young men who were obviously master craftsmen far ahead of what their ages would suggest were on the job They epitomized professionalism Tremendously talented and a pleasure to have work in our home When the time came to finish the hardwood floors and the newly rebuilt staircase in the foyer Bob revealed his wizard of hard wood  Eugene Eugene is a Rembrandt in terms of matching new stain with that first put down 30 years ago  They blend seamlessly  Every day Bob Gockeler was on site reviewing and inspecting the progress making sure that the work held up to his very high standards which far surpassed ours as homeowners When complete the team retreated as if they had never been on site the worksite was clean all debris removed Not a day goes by that we dont remark how much we love this new addition  Thank you Bob

The master bathroom is perfect Nicole at Wayne Tile was knowledgable and professional She helped me pick out the perfect carrera marble in one day Andrew did an amazing job installing it He is truly talented We are very happy with the Perrin and Rowe fixtures that Kim helped us to select

All of the people associated with Kraftmaster are professional and give the utmost care to detail  No item is too small to be given huge attention  The utmost care was given to my entire home throughout our renovation  Everyone was on time and always delivered exactly what they promised  Every renovation causes an interruption to your normal household flow this one was almost undetectable thanks to the entire crew  Great Job Kraftmaster

They are a pleasure to work with and possess a professionalism that instills confidence  GlassCrafters Inc

We are so thrilled with the way our kitchen turned out  From the beginning Bob and his team were very thoughtful had great suggestions and asked tons of questions to build a kitchen according to the needs of our lifestyle  The work they did was impeccable and kept us in the loop of when everything was going to be done  We were nervous because of all the bad stories you hear about renovations but we had no problems nor delays  A much better experience than we could have imagined coupled with the end result made us want to do more including our family room and powder room We would recommend Kraftmaster for their thoroughness communication and excellent work  Thanks Bob and team

Our experience with Kraftmaster Renovations has been fantastic There are many people who own their own company but Bob Gockeler is much more than an owner  he is a leader and the people who work for him follow his example Bob has so much integrity and is a person of his word That might sound like fluff but its not  its absolutely true He has an amazing attention to detail follows through on everything that he says he will do and makes great suggestions and recommendations without being judgmental or pushy Whats so amazing  because its so rare  is that he has managed to assemble an entire company of likeminded people that truly care about the quality of their work

Everyone who works for this company is great at what they do and is a true professional If we had to pick 3 things that make Kraftmaster different from everyone else wed say 1 They genuinely care about the quality of your project from beginning to end 2 Unlike so many construction companies that use subs they employ their work crews so you see the same teams of workers throughout your project 3 Their work crews are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet and put in a full days work every day allowing your project to get done on time 

We would not hesitate to use Kraftmaster again  in fact we cant imagine using anyone else

Bob  Co did an incredible transformation in our beautiful old 1800s house with a 1970s era kitchen Of all the people we interviewed he was the most straightforward with budget deadlines etc 

What neither of us anticipated was the previous owners that did the 70s renovation on the kitchen did so without permits or skill and because of moisture damages Bob had the fun job of figuring out how to gut the ENTIRE kitchen down to the dirt and up to the ceiling I cant stress enough how diligent and fair he was in figuring out how to achieve this without completely breaking the bank We feel that if we would have chosen any other company we would have been left in the dust literally  

In the process we turned lemons into lemonade and moved some walls around added a wet bar switched the bath and Laundry rooms and he took on all the challenges gloriously Hes not one to bark orders either while disgruntled workers do his bidding he gets in there and does some of the work himself not afraid of getting his hands dirty Hes also really thoughtful about solving problems and I never saw him lose his cool during the entire process His design partner Kim also helped us figure out the layout colors finishes etc and agreed to meet us at showrooms on weekends nights or whenever we wanted

Bob also worked really well with our flooring and insulation companies to time everything out and organize what needs to happen and when

So now we have an incredibly beautiful new kitchen on a solid foundation a new bathroom laundry room and because of removing a wall in another part of the house a beautiful open concept living room He even mounted our TV 

Well definitely use Kraftmasters again for our future renovations watch out 70s master bathroom and would highly recommend them to whoever needs a competent friendly hardworkingtruetohisword contractor

KraftMaster Renovations remodeled our kitchen and did a fabulous job  We interviewed several companies and Bob was able to give us our dream kitchen  The KraftMaster team was very professional and neat  They cleaned up each and every day which is a major plus  I would recommend KraftMaster to everyone

Let me start by saying that the work that Bob and his team did on my kitchen bathrooms and various other rooms is simply beautiful This is a team of professionals  and I stress the word professionals  that go above and beyond to make sure that your vision comes to fruition Never at any time did we hear the words  cant be done  This company truly cares about the work they do and it shows I also must add that during the entire process every time we reached out to Bob with a question or concern he was always available to talk which is hugely important while going thru a renovation I would never under any circumstance consider doing any work in my house without Bob and KraftMaster leading the way

KraftMaster Renovations completed our kitchen renovation and we cannot be more delighted with the outcome  They were able to open up the area between the kitchen and dining room as well as replacing a window with a French door to the outside to make for a beautiful and  functional space that has a better flow and is overall a big improvement to our quality of life in our house  

Bob was always sensitive and responsive to any questions or suggestions and his designer Robin had the vision that  considered our desires while making sure that the final outcome was functional and lovely

Christine

We had our kitchen renovated several years ago and in the process also had all the flooring in our home replaced with a laminate flooring  The results are fantastic  I love the new kitchen design layout which included a slight change to the flow through the house  Its just awesome  The quality and workmanship is great and was done within our budget

As the father of a severely mentally and physically handicapped son we constantly face disappointment When we required a bathroom to be  customized and build a walk in shower without any barriers allowing our son to be wheeled directly in the quotes and contractors we met with were either uninterested lacked imagination or the credentials Our last meeting was with Bob He and his extraordinary crew of craftsmen spent hours discussing drawing and reviewing the project Regardless of the unexpected obstacles they faced they remained steadfast and undeterred in ensuring the project remained on time and on budget In fact when a vendor priced a product too low Kraftmaster kept to their contractual and ethical standards and automatically paid the higher price instead of handcuffing us and making us pay Their team never missed a day worked weekends never left to work on another job and Bob constantly visited to ensure that no stone was left unturned Furthermore the bathroom will appeal to those who are non handicapped due to the innovative design and finishing details No I am not related to Bob No Bob did not pay me or promise to do work nocharge for this recommendation There is often a disconnect in the construction world between work ethics and morals Therefore I wrote this because it doesnt cost a penny to say something nice for an excellent company  especially when it had such an important impact on our sons quality of life If you dont believe me visit Bobs site to see our bathroom or ask Bob to see our bathroom and meet our son 

Ira Guberman
Florham Park NJ

Bob and his team at KraftMaster Renovations did a brilliant job renovating my kitchen  We went from a boxey dark old kitchen to an open concept bright welcoming and highly functional space  They listened to our needs and created a design that complements our lifestyle  Some of my favorite features include a large 6 sided island with microwave drawer and hidden outlets plenty of work space between the island and the sink stove area and great undercounter lighting   Another highlight was taking down the wall between the kitchen and dining room and putting in a lovely arch which creates definition of the two spaces while giving an open feel to the space  

Bob took us through his process set our expectations and delivered as promised  Robin was fantastic in assisting with final design choices such as lighting tile and even paint colors  We absoutely love our new kitchen and we highly recommend KraftMaster Renovations

I had my kitchen done through KraftMaster Renovations Bob was great to work with and him and his team did an excellent job remodeling my kitchen I was very happy with the work they did and they finished the job the same time they promised I would highly recommend them

We did a renovation of the whole main floor over the Summer It was a pleasure to work with this company Everything was possible nothing was too much for them It was a large project and it took a while but now that everything is done we are so happy It worked out perfectly Thanks to Bob Robin and Andrew for all the hard work the patience and the optimism

We got lucky in finding Bob We were referred to him from another Professional in our area that left their previous job to go and work with KraftMaster 

We loved the fact that Bob came over to our home to meet with us and be our go to person in our remodel Bob knew all of the construction folks and I felt so secure allowing him into our home

I would highly recommend Bob and KraftMaster to anyone seeking a remodel of their home

Our dream master bathroom became a reality with thanks to the team at KraftMaster  After researching countless hours online and meeting multiple contractors  we found KMR was the perfect fit for us We had lots ideas limited budget and wanted to be an integral part of the renovation process We were seeking a team that would hold our hand every step of the way had impeccable attention to detail provided the necessary thought leadership and had well documented examples of master bathroom transformations which is initially what lead us to their website

Kim was very helpful and patient during the design and redesign process as well as also with our visits to the showrooms and supply houses  Andrii is not only a master at his construction trade he is a true professional that is meticulous friendly and a very hard worker  Each day he would spent extra time for the clean up efforts and educating us on next steps Robby ensured last minute supplies were delivered and was onsite managing all of our inspections in a friendly and personable fashion

Bob and his team all possess the qualities that we rarely find in this business   passionate meticulous friendly neat clean best in class craftsmanship and a trusted partner  Its now been 3 months since our bathroom was transformed and it still feels as though we are visiting a spa Our bathroom came out better than we ever could have imagined Thanks to everyone at KraftMaster Renovations Pete  Betsy

We are very happy with the end result of our project with Bob and his team  We have an older 1920s home and we knew we were in for a lot of probably unpleasant surprises  Bob was never fazed by anything that came up during the project  Five layers of ceiling demolished on the first day  Needing to replace a toilet in the bathroom upstairs that turned out to be from 1935  A basement full of plumbing in various stages of disintegration  Not only Bob but his entire team were always positive professional and excited with the results of their work  This was our first major renovation project and we are so happy with how it turned out  His designers Robin and Jessica really helped to guide our choices although I will say it is always best to have a good idea of what you want from the beginning  Tony Adam and his entire team were also friendly and professional

Our home has been transformed from a disjointed nightmare prior addition with inlaw suiterental apartment had the only usable kitchen to a floor plan that flows from one end of the ground floor to the other  All of this was accomplished in keeping with the traditional feel of the house and with a reasonable budget considering how much was accomplished  A year ago I couldnt sit in the kitchen and type this review on my laptop and hear the kids if they went to another roomnow all I have to do is lean back and I can see them

We highly recommend Bob and would work with him again

Bob and his team did an amazing job designing our new kitchen  We now have a functional room with plenty of  work space and storage space and it is visually  stunning to boot  From our initial meeting through the design process and the installation Bob Robin and the rest of the team were easy to work with  professional and dedicated working right through Super Storm Sandy to getting the job done right Addtionally the project came in on budget  and there were minimal bumps along the way We couldnt be happier with the end result

It is atypical to find a company and owneroperator with the morals ethics standards of excellence creativity and personality that meets or exceeds their representation or quotation Customer service fairness and peace of mind are typically not associated with contractors let alone most companies In Bobs case these are exactly his characteristcs and those of his workers As the father of a handicapped son I required a bathroom remodeling that had to be sophisticated yet practical I required a crew that was professionally responsible and timesensitive to the project Bob is a handson honorable forthright gentleman He is not a yes man in the sense of agreeing to anything and everything just to get a job His input provokes thought and positive results Unlike other contractors who model after magicians and disappear after the contract is signed Bob was at the work site each day  morning afternoon and sometimes evenings His crew works for him and are craftsmen who take pride in their work and showed up on time each day including weekends Bobs contract was professional specific detailed and he did not nicke and dime for specific changes that most other contractors would have done so for they are not interested in building long term relationships and either dont care or understand the value of word of mouth which can either be a businessmans best friend or worst enemy Needless to say the result of the bathroom exceeded my expectations the contract price did not and Bob is a man of his word and worthy of a phone call when you consider a home improvement project I know that I will not hesitate to call him again in the future

I hired Bob to renovate design and rebuild my two bathrooms in my home He did a great high quality job He worked with me every step of the way and made me feel very comfortable Even with no planned budget he kept costs to a very reasonable level Bob is a good fit if you are looking for high quality work and can accomodate anyones budget high or low His designers did a great job on everything

Kraftmaster Renovations and Bob Gockeler gave me the kitchen I have been dreaming about for years

 Despite my anal attention to detail and lastminute plan changes he never made me feel I was out of order in my opinions or proposals 

He was just as excited as I was every step of the way and especially with the finished product His crew was clean reliable and trustworthy

Our 50 year old kitchen needed to be gutted and we were looking for a contractor that did both the design work and construction Once we met with Bob we didnt need to look further as his quiet enthusiasm and love for design and construction customer service and quality was evident throughout our discussion Bob listened well to what we wanted gave us several creative designs was able to easily adjust as the work progressed and we requested changes All throughout he was upfront on costs and options handled the unforeseen behind the wall structural and plumbing surprises the two layers of ceilings the 5 layers of floors and guided us in making the many decisions on the design and materials He never took shortcuts when faced with problems to fix and took the extra time to do the job right

His work crew was on time very polite professional hard working and cleaned up the work area before leaving each night Bob stayed on top of all the issues was always accessible and was patient in guiding us through the process always keeping our vision in mind We couldnt wait to get home each night and see the progress We thoroughly enjoyed working with Bob and his crew and are delighted with the great design attention to detail high quality work and the resulting gorgeous functional kitchen that was beyond our dream Bob provides a high quality customer focused service and we would highly recommend him and his team

We moved from the city to the suburbs and we knew going in that we wanted to redo the kitchen and open up the living space as soon as spring came around Initially we interviewed a couple architects but all they wanted to do was to mold the house into their vision and not ours Then we found Bob and he immediately knew what we wanted to do with the space and more importantly knew our design aesthetic He came up with a great kitchen design open floor plan and created the perfect space for us Given our budget we had resigned ourselves to semicustom cabinetry but Bob came through again He was able to get us a fully custom kitchen with virtually no change in the budget We gave Bob yet another challenge a time challenge We were expecting our second child and we needed all major construction to be done by time the new baby arrived Bob came through with flying colors All major construction was done ahead of schedule We couldnt have been happier Not only was the work done
in time the quality of the work was top notch and the construction crew are professional and courteous

There are several general contractors we could have gone with but Bob is special He is a great combination of an architect kitchen designer and general contractor He has a great breadth of knowledge when it comes to home construction and we couldnt have chosen better We would definitely use him for any future home improvement projects and would highly recommend him to others

Backyard transformation The most critical phase of any project is choosing the right designercontractor to do the job right the first time When I  started the process I contacted three contractors and had them send out their designer It quickly became apparent that the scope and complexity of my project would require a special designer So I started over and I started researching designers not just the contractors as I had done the first time a round After several weeks of research I narrowed it down to two designers Mike Farley was my first call After speaking with Mike over the phone and answering some of his questions I was confident I had found my designer I decided I would wait until we met in person to make my final decision Once I met Mike in person and walked the site of the project I was 100 confident in his ability and knowledge This was a totally different experience than I had with the other three designers I knew I had found my designer and Contractor and we begin the process The process has been seamless from the initial design phase through the revisions and the selection process Mike has been there to answer all my questions and also offer his opinion and expertise which has made this a great experience If youre looking for a  world class designer look no further Mike Farley is your guy

made to me he convinced me I wasnt dealing with someone I can trust to do business with   I Really hate it when people act nice just to get your business but when they realize they lost it they stop I personally have not had a good experience with this company that I hired for Christmas lights installation To begin I made an appointment for an estimate and since they were running late and could not make it I sent a picture They replied with markings on where the lights would be I agreed and scheduled When the crew arrived they installed the lights but missed a part of the roof stating that it was too steep to install the lights there When I showed the crew the markings they went ahead and installed them The light chords were just hanging instead of being neatly tucked in so you would not see them from the street They stated that is why they use thin cables I have since driven around areas to see other lights and even my own neighbor few doors down did not have any cables showing Couple of weeks before Christmas the lights fell down had to reach out for them to come out and reinstall To their credit they did come the following day The lights fell down again few days ago which shattered on my porch and left glass on the ground had to reach out to them again At that point since it was after Christmas I asked for them to be removed They showed up and with a pole they removed lights and clips but left three on the roof and left Have sent them two messages asking why they left three clips on the roof when they should have removed all of them They did not bother to reply  All in all the lights did not look very good as some did not even point in the same direction and the cables were hanging Definitely not as neat as i have seen elsewhere in other homes It was a sloppy half job that I paid way too much for Now I also have to pay someone to remove the remaining clips I most certainly would not recommend Torres Landscaping for lights install

This review or for mounting and installation I talked to Ben about four possible tasks that I needed done 2 motion sensor solar panel light mounting 1 door reinforcer installation and 1 cabinet hinge repair Initially I asked if all four projects could be done in an hour However after our discussion it sounded like it would take more than an hour so I I asked Ben to prioritize the lights first to see how much he can do in an hour which he agreed Ben installed the two lights on a nonflat surface and on one of the lights a difficult angle and reach Ben used his own tools and I advised him to bring specialized tools which I didnt have to drill into concrete which I didnt know how to do either Ben did tactfully completed this task Since I was satisfied I decided to proceed with Bens services for the second hour to install the door reinforcer and fix the cabinet hinges Ben and I strategized ways to install the door reinforcer He used another special tool to remove the trim after taking measurements and I suggested fasteners were better than the screws the manufactured provided Ben already had a tray of different screws including the fasteners prepared Ben installed the door reinforcer with the fasteners and tested it He successfully accomplished this task Third Ben was able to easily fix the cabinet screws and now the cabinet works fine Conclusion Ben took 100 minutes of 120 minutes to finish all four tasks Mathematically speaking Ben finished the job 20 minutes faster and was 16 more efficient than I expected In terms of efficacy on a scale on 15 5 being the best I rate him a 5 out of 5 I highly recommend Ben on future projects   Side note Bens professional experience AND Bachelors AND Masters Degree in Mechanical Engineering makes him standout as a

Surprisingly I did not have a very good experience with FixTman but I want to note they did give a lot of opportunity to make things right   It all starts when I reached out when the time window of arrival was closing and I was never contacted about the technician being late and I had to reach out myself Ultimately I had waited the entire time and didnt get any update on when the technician would arrive until well after the time window had passed They were understanding and apologetic saying this never happens unfortunately it did for me Real professionalism I would have expected them to contact me if there were schedule issues at the very least They gave me a slight discount for the troubles and genuinely wanted to make up for it so I do appreciate that Finally about 2 hours after the arrival window the technician arrived They had communicated the final time after but nevertheless it was still later than that time  The technician was rushed very rushed The attention to detail was not there I paid for an entire TV mounting yet I was expected to help I actually had to change my plans to be there that late and I still had to lift the heavy TV on and off of the mount a few times and he even asked my wife to help as well Why am I paying for an installation when Im so actively helping I dont mind helping but I also would rather not be paying for myself to do some of the work It just seemed really weird  In addition I told him clearly and marked exactly where and how high to mount the TV but even then its still too low and not where I wanted it He really didnt want to go the extra mile to make sure I was happy  I didnt want to fight it or make it worse Its just not worth my time But now I have a nice new TV mounted in a suboptimal way Its supposed to be really flush with the wall but he used an extension chord that is in the way which he also asked me to pay for We wouldnt need an extension chord if he actually put the TV in the right spot and cut the inwall channel in the middle rather than way over on the right  Overall it was a really rushed job and I had to help out a lot Also I was told they wouldnt haul the boxesshipping material away but would put it in the trashrecycling but he also didnt do it I just wanted him to finish because it was so rushed and unpleasant I spent another hour breaking down the box and cleaning up afterwards and then spent another hour trying to fix the mistakes and get the TV flush like it should be There were so many steps he didnt do and even mentioned that those steps were for amateurs Unfortunately that also means amateurs do a good job at making sure the mount is flush and setup as designed  The technician was nice but the rushed nature sucked  The company did say they would have a QC technician come out to take a look and fix if they could They would honor a 30 day guarantee So I definitely think they want to make it right and I think they would But the QC technicians window of arrival was a huge 3 hour window the next day That additional stress of it all waiting again for 3 hours just wasnt going to cut it for me  They genuinely want to do the right thing but man I really didnt have a good time and maybe Ill ultimately take their offer to get their QC technician out here but it was just not a good experience at all and I really dont know if I want to deal with another round of it  I think the way to make this right 1 Have the technician come at an EXACT time not a 3 hour window 2 Refund me some more portion of the cost because of how much I was expected to help 3 Actually redo the job patch up the holes and not require my help maybe bring a second or third technician  I hope this is just a one time thing and that otherwise they are great at what they do I will be looking elsewhere and just wanted to leave this in case its useful

Update Almost immediately after posting my 1 star review I got a message from the company They apologized and said they were confused because I already had an appointment scheduled to fix the issue at no cost I never got a message asking when I was available or confirming any appointments   When I asked when my appointment was for they said Thursday from 35 Thursday around 1pm I got a text asking if they could come on Friday instead I said I was available before 830 or after 1030 They said okay confirmed  I asked what time my appointment was and they had scheduled me from 8301030 Exactly when I was not available I explained my schedule again and they said they would come at 8   They actually arrived at 805 and fixed everything and it looks great now The end result is great but all the hard work of scheduling and rescheduling this service so many times was not worth it I will not use this company again   Original 1 star review While it seems like they typically have great service I did not have a great experience  I originally scheduled an appointment for 4pm on a Wednesday They arrived at 245 and unfortunately my baby was in the middle of his nap I asked if they could come back at my scheduled time maybe see another client first because I didnt want the sound to wake the baby They said no and asked if they could come the next morning at 8am and I agreed  At 835 the next morning they had not arrived yet I texted them asking if they would be there by 9 because the baby would be napping again at 915 They said there was a lot of traffic and they could not make it by 9 and we rescheduled for the next day at 330 They said We will be there at 330 on the dot  The next day they arrived at 445 They put the tv up and seemed to be in a bit of a rush While they were putting it up I wasnt sure if it was quite right but I saw them measuring and assumed they are the experts and know what they are doing I should have double checked right at that moment When the tv was up it looked fine and they left quickly After looking at the TV a bit longer I realized it was not centered on the fireplace Within an hour I messaged them saying that it was not centered and asking if it could be fixed I specifically said there is 195 inches of space on one side and 165 inches of space on the other side They scheduled an appointment for a few days later at 4 pm  At 345 they called me and said do you still want us to come today or should we come tomorrow I said please come I am ready So they come at 430 One of the guys was there a few days earlier but he did not speak English The other guy was new and he spoke English and acted as translator The guy who was the same immediately started measuring things The new guy looks at me and says Did someone else do this You can see just by looking at it that its not centered And I said no actually you did he was here the other day with someone else And he said wow Im sorry We will make this right   The two men chat a bit and then he tells me we basically have to redo the whole thing They didnt give us much time today They just said you needed it straightened so is it OK if we come back another time He again tells me we will make this right I agree to yet another visit and he tells me that the scheduling service will need to call me to set up time  A few hours later someone calls me and says so it sounds like we have to redo it so I just wanted to see if you still wanted to proceed I ask him to confirm that I will not be charged since it was their mistake We go back and forth a bit he seems to have some incorrect details for example stating thatI asked for service on two tvs which I did not and then he says it seems like maybe we have some inaccurate information and maybe your records got mixed up Is it OK if I give you a call back I say yes and he never calls back So now I paid them almost 200 for a crooked TV and will now have to pay someone else to fix it

They mounted a 65 TV on my living room wall The first time I pulled the tv out so I can see it better from the kitchen the mount has an adjustable arm and is designed for this type of movement the tv and mount fell off the wall They both came right off the wall The company took 0 of the responsibility The TV fell onto a marble table and the tv screen cracked the mount bent and it the iPhone sitting on the table was damaged  They sent two men from the company to assess the damage and take pictures A manager then called and incessantly stated it was not the companys fault due to the evidence ie the pictures THEIR company took and THEIR department reviewed At nauseam he repeated it was not their fault and continued to reference THEIR assessment of the situation and implied that the accident was a result of an outer force applied to it When we asked what this could be his reply insinuated we had done it by maybe applying to much pressure someone hanging from it etc We did neither but had no way of proving it How do we as customers prove to a company with legal council we did no such thing This is unfair and onesided Company v me and my wife Their conclusion that it was not their fault and therefore we would not be compensated is clearly onesided and unfair We are out of about 2500 We would have never imagined that using Thumbtack to refer us to this company would result in a loss of 2500 cost of tv 2000 cost of wall mount 165 cost of installation 185 time and inconvenience   It is 100 their fault and they are taking 0 of the responsibility I will never use this company I will repost this review on Yelp

Its hard to review these people and I feel sorry that this happened to myself but it can happen again and again The main issue is that they send two pros one is the main pro who may or may not speak in English and the other who is actually not a pro but a translator for English This makes it really hard to communicate to the actual person doing the job In our case the translator was very sensitive to our demands took everything personally    Now as for the real review on the work we had to mount a soundbar and also a curtain rod We told them to NOT level the soundbar with the TV as it was not leveled itself and we could adjust the tv later but they didnt hear or didnt understand and weve had to then get in to some argument around it was a terrible experience After that the soundbar was not centered and they again went in to an argument with me about it and I had to bring my own tape measure to show them it was off by a whole darn inch They then fixed it by redoing the screws again so now there are 2x holes behind my soundbar does not show but the shabbiest job ever for a simple mount   Ok now for the curtains they did a good job listening to instructions this time but they left the curtain rod completely lose Me and my wife had to tighten all the brackets with the provided Allen key When I had confronted them that it was lose they said they could manage only that   Terrible service I would never go for these people

I bought a new MantleMount one of those tv mounts that drops down over a fire place and needed it installed I filled in my information request exactly what I needed how heavy my tv was pictures etc and then was told the day before that I would need to help the one guy coming unless I wanted to pay more Im nine months pregnant and obviously wasnt up for helping hold a 70 tv I found this to be deceiving that they quoted me low but then had these additional charges for extra guys and an additional charge for dismounting my current tv when I clearly stated in my initial job request that my tv would need to be dismounted I would have appreciated transparency with the initial quote  they quoted me 180 and it ended up being closer to 300  The worst part was the guys that came out seemed to have never installed a mount like this before They placed the mount way too low at first and it wouldnt even come back up over the mantle They came back after I had to measure and prove to them that they could place it higher without hitting the ceiling and then they placed it way too high and didnt even make the sound bar flush with the tv Eventually my husband and fatherinlaw redid it and now it looks good but it took a lot of work since the guys that came out stripped a lot of the screws the mount came with   Im giving them 2 stars for coming out to try and fix it but ultimately we had to fix it a third time ourselves to get it right Wish I could get my 300 back Also just a small note but the cologne one man was wearing was way too strong and left a scent in the room for the day As a nurse I dont wear perfume at work because I know people might be sensitive to it I believe these guys should adopt a similar approach to customer service   The photos are of the mount way too high and the sound bar not flush and my husband measuring it when it was too low and realizing it could go up and not hover over the mantle we took the sound bar off so it wouldnt hover over the mantle  even though the pros said you couldnt take it off   In the future I hope these guys just say up front if they dont know how to do a job versus do it incorrectly and try to convince me its right and theres nothing else they can do and leave They kept saying it would hit the ceiling if it was higher or that the sound bar cant come off Both of which we discovered were untrue   Would not recommend

Great experience working with Kevin He mounted our tv and hung a few heavy mirrors He was timely professional and friendly Would definitely recommend Kevin for

1 star for professional and prompt communication in the app  1 star for showing up on time  1 star for the portion of the work completed  Minus 2 stars for working extremely slow Details below  Why I rated 3 stars I only give 4 stars when I have zero complaints and I only give 5 stars when someone goes above and beyond in a truly spectacular way Thats why this was a 3 Other people rank simply passable average work as 5 stars but thats not the way I rate  Job Pulling weeds by hand Rate 49hr At the end he tried to say the rate was 60hr but I had our DMs where hed previously quoted 49hr  Details I asked Kevin to weed our small front yard and pull a few other weeds along an adjacent sidewalk I was clear upfront that I only wanted to pay for two hours max After 90 minutes  hed only weeded a corner that was about 4x4 and I asked him to pay attention to other areas with big obvious easilypullable weeds that were still sitting there He seems to pay a lot of attention to minuscule details while ignoring bigger more obvious things like 3 tall dandelions and entire swaths of tall weeds I wouldnt describe him as efficient eg using a weak leaf blower to blow 2 inches of dirt at a time when sweeping would be sooo much faster I asked him to stop after two hours since that was my agreement upfront He said hed add a few extra minutes for free and that he usually throws that in for clients He has a pleasant if slightly awkward communication styledemeanor But wow the slowness  even with a migraine I could have gotten more accomplished in half the time   The kicker is that the assigned work isnt complete  I either have to hire someone else to finish pulling the weeds or just do it myself For contrast I previously had someone on Craigslist to weed the entire front yard plus the parking strip in ONE hour for 50 I wish Id saved his number Hiring hourly on Thumbtack is frustrating  It would be better if we could price a job at a flat rate no matter how long it takes because hourly pricing seems to encourage people to work as slowly as possible Kevin is a nice guy but not a match for my expectations Good luck

Kevin is a kind guy but the work he did planting our trees was not well done We asked for 7 trees to be planted  and specified that we needed with holes dug 2x wide filled with new soil and gopher wire He did not do this Instead  the holes for all 7 trees were dug 24 inches wider than the root ball   only 1 tree was given new soil we purchased extra bags of soil for this and pointed them out to Kevin but he did not use them  only 2 trees were planted with gopher wire   We are currently replanting all 7 trees The avocado started to die because it was surrounded by clay instead of enough new soil and there were a lot of air pockets Kevin said it was normal for the tree to lose all leaves and come back next yearbut that didnt seem right Poor tree Weve replanted it with a hole twice as wide as the root ball new soil and leaves have stopped dropping New buds are forming Super thankful   This has been very frustratingWe paid 400 dollars across 2 visits and have to redo the work  the right way We will not work with Kevin again or recommend his services

I requested pressure washing for my driveway sidewalk picket fence and patio Id just say make sure you know what youre getting with the quote The scheduler and serviceman were nice but there were a couple things I didnt care for I was told the service person would arrive at 730AM and he didnt arrive until around 9AM and there was no communication at all saying hed be late He only apologized after I asked whether he knew he was supposed to arrive at 730AM Overall he did a good job but a few days later I realized he only did the inside of the fence When I requested a quote I said I had a picket fence and to me requesting pressure washing for a fence would be the whole fence both sides When I contacted the scheduler saying only one side was done she said the service person is not allowed to go into the neighbors yard or on the area where the lake is but he could come back to do that side if I paid 100 more My fence is not shared with a neighbor so there would have been no problem for him to walk around the exterior if he was concerned he could have asked me about that but didnt The scheduler said I didnt tell them I needed a doublesided fence done But isnt every fence doublesided To me when I ask for my fence to be cleaned Im asking for the entire fence The least they could have done was clarify whether I needed one side or both sides of the fence done I also didnt appreciate that the scheduler mentioned it costs them 40 to give me a quote its kind of unprofessional and I wasnt sure if she was trying to use that to make me feel like now I need to use them So they did a good job with what they did in terms of the quality of pressure washing but it definitely wasnt clear about the appointment time or the extent of what they would do Im now the owner of half of a nicely pressure washed fence and thankfully a well pressure washed driveway sidewalk and patio

I have a two story building which needed the gutters cleaned I had a few estimates of the exact same amount of 200 so to be fair I picked the first company that gave me that same price The person showed up pretty much on time but with only a step ladder no where tall enough and a leaf blower Ok so we let him use our tall ladder and whatever else was needed   After hours and one incident where he got himself stuck on the roof because the ladder fell over who knows how that happened we were informed that he could not do one side of our house because the roof was too steep he slipped and almost fell off he said and the ladder did not reach Then I was called to ask if I would be ok with him not doing that whole side and I replied that we are paying for the whole house to be done Thats what we were quoted for  Anyway they then sent another person to see what could be done and finished the job Turns out they used their van and put our tall ladder on top of the van and reached the gutters that way Completely unsafe but we didnt realize this until they were just about finished and we checked  Next thing I hear is that they were going to charge an extra 70 because they said our house needs some kind of lift and they took longer than expected Now mind you the first thing you can see driving up to our house is how tall it is on one side If there was an issue the right thing to do would have been to tell me upfront that they could not do the job or couldnt do it as quoted We would have then had a choice to continue or hire someone else but they decided it wasnt s problem and started It didnt become a problem until 34 of the job was done  I argued that I shouldnt have to pay extra because they quoted a price and they could have just declined the job after seeing our house After back and forth I ended up paying 240 as I am not completely unreasonable but I dont feel like I should have been guilted into paying extra especially after the mess they left All other quotes were including bagging up and removal of debris Rains doesnt seem to do that   The kicker though is that they started a case with Thumbtack saying I hadnt paid A WEEK LATER I have proof of payment of course and have sent all the info to Thumbtack  I am attaching some photos of the mess they left on just one side of the house all those leaves came from the gutters If I find the photos of all the leaves they blew onto our pool screen Ill add them but I cant find them at the moment And all the leaves and dirt blown onto our pool deck  Moral here is to make sure they can do the job for the price quoted before they start If you dont they may put you in the position of paying extra because what are you going to do if theyve already done most of the work Also they need to have their own ladders and proper equipment as well as clean up after themselves
